Key Match Events: Lucas Erceg's scoreless streak ends in a late-inning loss vs. the Guardians
Naylor hit his 11th home run of the year to bring the Guardians within two runs
Steven Kwan and Andrés Giménez both went to the opposite field to put two on and nobody out for the Guardians' best hitter, José Ramírez
Erceg allowed a wild pitch, a single to Josh Naylor and two consecutive singles to Will Brennan and Johnkensy Noel -- all weak contact -- for the Guardians to take the lead
Pre-Game Insights: The Royals were going to need starter Michael Wacha to eat innings, and he logged six-plus
Quatraro wanted to stay away from Daniel Lynch IV, a traditional starter who threw 34 pitches in three scoreless innings on Monday
The Royals essentially had Erceg, Chris Stratton, and Steven Cruz available in the bullpen
Post-Match Reflections: Quatraro added: 'He'd been throwing the ball well, settled in nicely, had good life on his pitches. We thought that was a good spot for us to keep him going at the bottom of the order'
Erceg said: 'That's baseball in a nutshell. Sometimes you win, sometimes you lose. … Overall, the process stayed the same. I went out there and competed, and it didn’t go my way today.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Royals drop 1 game behind the Guardians in the American League Central with 29 games left
The Royals clinched the season series against the Guardians, leading 7-3 with three more games to play against them next week in Kansas City
